TopicTitle: Changing When Physics Loads In For Non-Active Vessels?

Articles.Content:
I am trying to do a stunt that involves a fast approach to another craft and then running into it, otherwise explained as driving a car up a ramp. I have managed to do this at Mach 1 so far on Kerbin, but want to try it on a lower-gravity place. The main issue I am having is that physics only enables on the ramp when I get very close to it, which on Kerbin gravity didn't do a whole lot but in lower gravity the traditional 'hop' of physics turning on is much more pronounced. My ramp ends up being a meter off the ground at the critical time, completely unable to be driven up, and the only solution would be to alter when physics begins to apply to the ramp or go way slower (not acceptable).

I looked in the files and found Physics.CFG, with code like this at the end.. 

VesselRanges
{
	prelaunch
	{
		load = 2250
		unload = 2500
		pack = 350
		unpack = 200
	}
	landed
	{
		load = 2250
		unload = 2500
		pack = 350
		unpack = 200
	}
...

I really thought I was onto the winner here, but editing this to greater ranges had no effect at all.

Does anyone know how to enable physics on craft from greater distances?

You have it correct. It's the "landed" pack and unpack distances that you really want to increase -- that's the distance where physics turns on. You need to note how much time it takes the ramp to settle back down after the physics load bounce -- then figure how far your other vehicle will move in that amount of time.

Bumping the load and unload distances up by 10km or so seems to also work great on my system. There used to be problems in prior versions with bugs appearing if you used large values for the physics bubble size, but as far as I can tell they are gone. The devs exposed these values so that we could all test large physics bubble sizes and see if they still do or do not cause additional bugs in the new version.

@bewing Thanks for your reply. I turned the pack and unpack variables for the landed state up as follows; 2000 for unpack, and 2100 for pack. I considered that having them higher than the load or unload variables, or having unpack higher than pack could cause errors. After restarting the game and reloading my situation I observed no change, with the game taking a clear pause and the ramp jerking when I was nearby it, at the same distance as before the file was modified. Perhaps the changes require a new save game, new craft, or craft to be relaunched?

Hmmmm. No, it sounds like you are doing everything just right. I'll have to do some testing and look at it myself -- but if that isn't working for you then I'm afraid your stunt may be hopeless for now. Something may be hardcoded into the game that's causing the silly jumpy bounce -- it may not be the physics bubble.

@Nicole: Now that I think about it, there are some parts that bounce more than others. Arsonide put in some very clever code to try to make sure that landing legs don't bounce (much). Is your current ramp craft sitting on landing legs? If not, you may want to try them.
